title.narrative: Capacity Building of the Kenyan Refugee- and Asylum System

description.narrative:
The overall objective of the project is to strengthen the Kenyan government's capacity to provide protection and assistance to asylum seekers and refugees in accordance with international obligations.
The Kenyan government is committed to this objective through accession to international conventions (especially the Geneva Convention of 1951) and by adopting a national refugee legislation in 2007.
The project is aiming to assist the newly established Kenyan Department for Refugee Affairs, DRA, and thereby to strengthen the national Kenyan authorities to engage actively and independently in all matters relating to the protection of and assistance to asylum seekers and refugees residing in Kenya. Presently more than 550,000 registered refugees reside in Kenya (Dec 2013).

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management
